pages.text: My studies have shown that there are apparently different soul types. I can identify my own soul type with a the ritual called $(marked)Enlightenment's Sighing$().

pages.title: Common Souls
pages.text: I have sorted the soul types in three different groups: the common, rare and legendary souls. As one can think, the groups are sorted by rarity. The group of $(marked)Common Souls$() completely consists of $(marked)Elemental Souls$(), which are healthy souls with a focus on a certain element.

pages.title: Elemental Souls
pages.text: The sub-group of Elemental Souls includes six soul types: Aether, Air, Earth, Fire, Water and Magan Souls. They have all been created by multiversal influences with a dominating aspect. $(br2)$(l)Aether Soul$()$(br)-unimplemented $(br)$(l)Air Soul$()$(br)Fleetfeet. This word describes inheritors of Air Souls the best. Them knowing their souls makes them even more agile.
$(l)Earth Soul$()$(br)-not really there either$(br)$(l)Fire Soul$()$(br)-nope $(br)$(l)Water Soul$()$(br)-noper $(br)$(l)Magan Soul$()$(br)-nopest

pages.title: Rare Souls
pages.text: The $(marked)Rare Souls$() are often built incorrectly or were lowly manipulated by an external force (of the special kind, mind you). People with rare souls often get interesting advantages at a cost.
